page.title: 11Local Tourist Attractions
page.content: {Shire Horse Centre}This is one of the main tourist attractions in the South West.It comprises 60 acres of land,an arena, daily parades of shire horses, a restaurant which seats 200 many country craft shops & demonstrations. {Kitley Caves}These were accidently found by local quarry men blasting for limestone in 1880. After being neglected they were cleared and illuminated in the 1970s, and opened to the public.Inside are strange rock formations and pools.Recent excavations have discovered bones of hyenas,bears bison and deer. The caves are open Easter to September, free to local residents. {Mother Hubbards Cottage}The nursery rhyme was written by Sarah Catherine Martin in 1804 while on a visit to Kitley House.The character of Mother Hubbard was based on the Housekeeper.
